metadata.name: Potential Fake Instance Of Hxtsr.EXE Executed
metadata.comment: HxTsr.exe is a Microsoft compressed executable file called Microsoft Outlook Communications. HxTsr.exe is part of Outlook apps, because it resides in a hidden "WindowsApps" subfolder of "C:\Program Files". Any instances of hxtsr.exe not in this folder may be malware camouflaging itself as HxTsr.exe

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\hxtsr.exe')) AND NOT (contains(lower(process.name), lower(':\\program files\\windowsapps\\microsoft.windowscommunicationsapps_')) AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\hxtsr.exe'))))

output.summary: HxTsr.exe is a Microsoft compressed executable file called Microsoft Outlook Communications. HxTsr.exe is part of Outlook apps, because it resides in a hidden "WindowsApps" subfolder of "C:\Program Files". Any instances of hxtsr.exe not in this folder may be malware camouflaging itself as HxTsr.exe

metadata.objective: False positive: Unknown Reference: Internal Research
